alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 06 at 5:23PM AKST until November 08 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 15 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph, reducing visibility to one quarter mile at times in blowing snow. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very hazardous.
